Pre-Game Insights: Canada and Uruguay will face off in the Copa América third-place match on July 13, 2024.
Uruguay is currently ranked 14th in the world and is the only team to have defeated Argentina since the 2022 World Cup.
Uruguay lost to Colombia in the semi-finals and may have suspensions or discipline issues ahead of the match.

Canada's head coach, Jesse Marsch, has mentioned potential changes to the starting lineup and the possibility of giving more playing time to players like Ali Ahmed, Mathieu Choinière, Tani Oluwaseyi, and Luc de Fougerolles.
Others: The match will take place at Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Marcelo Bielsa is the coach of Uruguay.
Guillermo Varela and Rodrigo Bentancur are likely unavailable for Uruguay due to suspension and injury respectively.
